column2: Do a visual check to make sure there are no observable assembly problem. refer to Schematic 0378290-000_AC.pdf and incorporated Wirelist if needed.
The AC PDU show have already been check the wiring continuity. Complte this check of no alerady done.Refer to Schematic 0378290-000_AC.pdf and incorporated Wirelist if needed.
Attach the Power Cord from AC PDU rear panel position J1 to an appropriate receptacle. The voltage source must be 208Vac. 3-Phase W/Neutral and Ground(5-wire wye configuration).
Measure  TB1‐1A to TB1‐4A (expecting infinity "OL").
Measure TB1‐7A to TB1‐10A (expecting infinity "OL").
Measure TB2‐1A to  PS1 (+). (expecting infinity "OL").
Measure  TB1‐1A to TB1‐4A (expecting infinity "OL").
Measure TB1‐7A to TB1‐10A (expecting infinity "OL").
Measure TB2‐1A to  PS1 (+). (expecting infinity "OL").

The fan at the rear panel of the AC PDU should be running.
The PLC Run/Stop and Maint lights should flash for 10 secs and
Just the Run/Stop should flash.
The RUN/STOP, ERROR and MAINT will flash for about 30 sec.
Wait until only the MAINT light flashes.

Starting with switch DI‐1 to DI-18; turn  on . Verify that the LED next to each switch is on when the switch is on   then turn switches DI‐1 through DI‐18  off
Set the Daughter Board “SERV MODE” switch on. The LED DO‐21 should flash once every 2 seconds. Leave the switch on.
Set the Daughter Board “STAGE OVERD” switch on. The LED DO‐21 should flash twice every 2 seconds. Leave the switch on.
Set the Daughter Board “DC PWR STAT” switch on. The LED DO‐21 should flash 3 times every 2 seconds and the “MTR RELAY” LED should come on.
With a DVM, check the voltage between X and Y (expecting 200‐240Vac..).
With a DVM, check the voltage between Y and Z (expecting 200‐240Vac..).
With a DVM, check the voltage between X and Z (expecting 200‐240Vac..).
With a DVM, check the voltage between X and N at the connector (expecting 108‐125Vac..).
With a DVM, check the voltage between X and G at the connector (expecting 108‐125Vac..).

Verify that the dials on K12 (the large green relay near the front of the PDU) are set properly.
 Max = 40, Min = 20 and Delay = 0.
Press the front panel “System Start” button to turn on the AC PDU and verify that the DO-8 LED (24VDC power) on the test fixture and the U LED on K12 are on. Verify DO-13 is off.
Switch on DI-3 and the front panel LED “Cluster” and the DO-13 LED should be on.
Switch off DI-3 and the PDU should shutdown. Switch DI-3 on again and the PDU should come back on with the “Cluster” LED on.
Test Fixture Verify LED's DO-9.

Turn on CB1 and CB2 and verify that the PLC CPU and Module RUN/STOP lights are green after 30 seconds.

Set all fixture Motherboard switches toward the front (off position). Set all Daughter Board switches in the full down position (off position). Ensure all other front panel circuit breakers OFF. (Except CB1 and CB2).
With a DVM, check the AC voltage at J4 from rear panel of unit. Turn ON CB3, the voltage between the L and N pins should be 208Vac.. Turn OFF CB3 after check.
With a DVM, check the AC voltage at J7 from rear panel of unit. Turn ON CB4, the voltage between the L and N pins should be 208Vac.. Turn OFF CB4 after check.
With a DVM, check the AC voltage at J10 from rear panel of unit. Turn ON CB7, the voltage between the L and N pins should be 208Vac.. Turn OFF CB7 after check
